page.title: 16RIVERBANKS:WILDLIFE RESOURCE
page.content: 8Kms.of the NITH & its tributaries, SCAR,SHINNEL&CAMPLE pass through this section.These are spate rivers,exten -sively provided with flood banks where there is often dense vegetation. Elsewhere the river margins may be heavily treed,alder,willow & sycamore predominating.There is no apparent pollution & the rivers support many invertebrate animals which are the food for fish in their immature form & for birds as winged adults.Many other kinds of insects breed in the damp adjoining ground.Thus the watercourse network constitutes a linear resource for wildlife,providing food and habitat for residents and a safe highway for migrating creatures,esp- ecially valuable in an area where there is a dearth of substantial hedgerows.
